snippet.title: White House Lights - Barron Trump Sings About The Pope
snippet.description:
White House Lights (A Song for the Pope)

Check us out on Spotify! https://open.spotify.com/album/3y1CZVxPBVqYl2ljdNVWno?si=lLRWLYbeQcuXD9TQDeKi7A

⬇️⬇️⬇️ Watch more videos below! ⬇️⬇️⬇️
https://youtu.be/WBHJZs8ZeFQ
https://youtu.be/GAdihLnAiXk
https://youtu.be/SZZW8YMZlMg?si=kP7ZE5s5fhhjjpX2
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hq_JjAodbY0

Lyrics:
I was walking through these halls again,
Golden frames and echoes in the wind.
A quiet day, the world stood still,
The Vatican bell rang on Capitol Hill.

They told me news from far away,
A shepherd gone, the world in gray.
Flags flew low, hearts bowed in prayer,
And silence filled the evening air.

[Chorus]
The White House lights are dim tonight,
Not red, not blue, just candlelight.
From D.C. to the sky so wide,
We’re sending love to Rome tonight.
I'm just a kid behind these walls,
But even I can feel the loss.
On behalf of this old house of white,
We're sorry that the Pope has died.

[Verse 2]
I never met the man, it’s true,
But faith is something that feels new.
And when the world feels torn apart,
Even presidents still mourn with hearts.

They say he spoke of peace and grace,
Of lifting souls in every place.
And though the world keeps moving on,
We feel the weight now that he's gone.

[Chorus]
The White House lights are dim tonight,
Not red, not blue, just candlelight.
From D.C. to the sky so wide,
We’re sending love to Rome tonight.
I'm just a kid behind these walls,
But even I can feel the loss.
On behalf of this old house of white,
We're sorry that the Pope has died.

[Bridge]
Sometimes the world looks to this place
For comfort, strength, a steady face.
But tonight, we just bow our head,
And honor what the good man said.

[Outro]
So here’s to hope and skies above,
To prayers and peace, and God is love.
In every church and every light,
We’re mourning with the world tonight.


All content, including references to real individuals, is created for entertainment purposes only. Any resemblance to actual persons, living or deceased, is purely coincidental or used in a satirical, transformative, or fictional context. This content is not intended to defame, embellish, misrepresent, or harm the reputation of any individual. No endorsement or affiliation is implied unless explicitly stated.
